articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sojourns in Jakarta
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sojourns in Jakarta
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday laid a wreath at the Cemetery of National Heroes in Jakarta. 
					 He and his party paid silent tribute to the martyrs who laid down their precious lives in the national liberation struggle in Indonesia. 
					
					That day Kim Yong Nam visited the National Monument. 
					
					 He was briefed on the fact that the monument was erected to convey the struggle of the Indonesian people for national independence down through generations and imbue the younger generation with patriotic idea. 
					
					  He also heard the recorded speech made by the first President Sukarno, when proclaiming the independence of Indonesia, and saw the document on the declaration of independence signed by him.
					
					 He and his party then went up to the observation deck of the monument and enjoyed a bird's-eye view of Jakarta.
					
					 He made entries in the visitor's books.

articles.title: Congratulations to Prime Minister-elect of Bahamas
articles.content:
Congratulations to Prime Minister-elect of Bahamas
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Monday sent a congratulatory message to Perry G. Christie, prime minister-elect of Bahamas.
					 The message sincerely wished him success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets Lao Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets Lao Delegation
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met with the visiting delegation of the Lao Women's Union headed by Sysay Leudedmounsone, president of its Central Committee, on May 14.
					 At a talk the head of the delegation said that the friendly relations between Laos and DPRK provided by President Kaysone Phomvihane and President Kim Il Sung have a long history.
					
					 "While visiting various places during my stay in the DPRK, I came to know well about its invincible might," she noted.
					
					 She expressed conviction that the friendly relations between the women's unions of the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Laotian Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Laotian Organisation
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un Sunday received a gift from the Central Committee of the Lao Women's Union.
					 Sysay Leudedmounsone, president of the Central Committee of the Lao Women's Union who is heading the visiting delegation, handed over the gift to Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: 15th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair Opens
articles.content:
15th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair Opens
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- An opening ceremony of the 15th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair took place at the Three-Revolution Exhibition Monday.
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Kang Sok Ju, vice-premier of the DPRK, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, and others, delegations of different countries and regions and diplomatic envoys of various countries and staff members of foreign embassies here.
					
					 A congratulatory speech by O Ryong Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, followed an inaugural speech made by Kim Mun Jong, president of the Korean International Exhibition Corporation. 
					
					 Speakers welcomed delegations of different countries and regions participating in the fair.
					
					 They said that the fair is a prestigious international economic gathering which reflects the desire and wish of mankind to establish a new international economic order based on independence and achieve the common prosperity and development.
					
					 He hoped that they would make good achievements through broad contacts and positive trade dealings.
					
					 They declared the DPRK would in the future, too, further expand and develop bilateral and multilateral cooperation in the fields of economy and trade with all countries and regions on the principle of equality and mutual benefit.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony, the participants looked round products from companies of the DPRK, Netherlands, Germany, Bulgaria, Switzerland, the UK, Austria, Italy, Finland, Poland, Australia, Malaysia, Mongolia, China and Taipei of China. 
					
					 The fair will last till May 17.

articles.title: National Symposium on Educational Science Held
articles.content:
National Symposium on Educational Science Held
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The first national symposium on educational science took place here on Sunday and Monday.
					 The symposium was divided into panels of ideology, theory and strategy of education, theory of basic education, contents and method of education in social science, contents and method of education in natural science and education information.
					
					 Presented to the symposium were at least 250 excellent papers on the achievements made by teachers, researchers and officials in studying educational science.
					
					 Among them were papers dealing with various matters arising in developing educational science as required by the trend of developing science and technology and asserting that the application of visual aid demonstration means to chemical experiments is an education method for increasing students' ability of cognition and practice.
					
					 They drew the attention of its participants for their great practical significance.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations Go Back
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations Go Back
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Foreign delegations left here on Monday.
					 They included the friendship delegation of the China Association for International Friendly Contact headed by its President Li Zhaoxing, the friendship delegation of the Agency for the Diplomatic Corps Service of Mongolia led by Director S. Bayarmunkh and the delegation of the Lao Women's Union headed by President of its Central Committee Sysay Leudedmounsone.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Speech Encourages Koreans to Build Thriving Nation
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Speech Encourages Koreans to Build Thriving Nation
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un, in his speech at the military parade marking President Kim Il Sung's 100th birth anniversary, stressed that by making the flames of the industrial revolution in the new century and the flames of Hamnam flare up more fiercely, the Korean people should take the road of building an economic power in a comprehensive way.
					 His remarks reminded the people of President Kim Il Sung, who appealed to the people to contribute to building new Korea, those with strength devoting their strength, those with knowledge giving their knowledge and those with money donating their money, after the liberation of the country from the Japanese colonial rule.
					
					 Kim Jong Un called on the people to cultivate with care the valuable seeds, which General Secretary Kim Jong Il sowed for the building of an economic power and the improvement of the people's standard of living, and bring them to brilliant fruition. He underlined that single-minded unity and invincible military might plus the industrial revolution in the new century is just the thriving socialist country.
					
					 Kim Jong Il turned the DPRK into a politico-ideological power as well as a military power and kindled the flames of industrial revolution in the new century in an aim to make a fresh turn in the economy.
					
					 Driven by the flames, the Huichon Ryonha General Machine Factory in Jagang Province updated itself as a standard one in the 21st century. The factory made a combined machining centre, a parent machine for processing the main body of CNC machine tools, thereby implementing Kim Jong Il's lifetime instructions.
					
					 All the fields of the nation's economy have been transformed to meet the requirements of knowledge-based economy.
					
					 The nation's self-supporting economy now serves as solid foundations for building a thriving nation.
					
					 Kim Jong Un also called upon the people to build an economic power in a comprehensive way and thus ensure that our people do not have to tighten their belts again, but enjoy all the benefits of socialism.
					
					 In response to his call, the Korean people are now pressing ahead with the building of a thriving nation, a way to realize the socialist ideal.

articles.title: Foreign Adherents to Juche Idea Laud Juche Idea, Songun Idea
articles.content:
Foreign Adherents to Juche Idea Laud Juche Idea, Songun Idea 
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The adherents to the Juche idea who visited the DPRK said that the Juche idea, Songun idea is the great idea in the present times whose validity and vitality have been proved in practice.
					 Edmond Jouve, director-general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that the Juche idea indicates the road for the popular masses to independently shape their destiny.
					
					 He noted that the idea is stirring up the progressive mankind including the Korean people for its scientific accuracy and truth.
					
					 The world progressive people are highly praising President Kim Il Sung, founder of the idea, as the eternal sun, he noted.
					
					 Ivan Draksler, chairman of the Slovak Association for Supporting the Juche Idea, noted that the idea is being widely disseminated worldwide, proving its vitality.
					
					 The Korean people have registered shining achievements by applying the idea, he said.
					
					 The Juche idea is the source of the Korean people's faith in independence and their tremendous strength.
					
					 The people could defend socialism while smashing the moves of the imperialist allied forces to stifle the DPRK as they have firmly maintained the independent stand in the revolution and construction, he noted.
					
					 He continued to say that the Juche idea, Songun idea is important guidelines to be followed by the countries and nations desirous of independence and progress.
					
					 Anarbek Usupbaev, chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Kyrgyzstan, said that the Juche idea, Songun idea is the great guiding idea indicating the road ahead of mankind in accomplishing the cause of independence.
					
					 Omar Lopez, chairman of the Venezuelan National Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, expressed the will to more thoroughly arm themselves with Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism to fulfill the noble mission and duty as the pioneer of the times disseminating the progressive idea.

articles.title: S. Korea's Lee Myung Bak Satirized by School Children
articles.content:
S. Korea's Lee Myung Bak Satirized by School Children
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Making analysis of the abbreviation for traitor Myung Bak (MB) of south Korea has become one of plays for students of secondary schools in Pyongyang.
					 On May 8, KCNA heard a conversation between secondary school students in the Pyongyang Metro. They were Jang Chol Hyon (12) and Ri Kang Song (12) at Pyongyang Sangsin Secondary School.
					
					 Jang: Hey, Ri, it is said that rattish Myung Bak likes more to speak American-style English than his own mother tongue. What about making analysis of the abbreviation "MB"?
					
					 Ri: The letter M has already been believed to come from the word "mouse".
					
					Then, what the letter B will stand for? As Myung Bak is considered to be a boss of the swarm of rats, B is appropriate to the word "boss".
					
					 Jang: But I think the word "break" is more suitable to it.
					
					 Ri: Oh, that's OK. Mouse Break!

articles.title: New TV Series on Screen in DPRK
articles.content:
New TV Series on Screen in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- A new TV series "Devote Yourself" has been broadcasted in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. 
					 The 10-part series is based on activities of a party official of Kyongwon County, North Hamgyong Province, whom General Secretary Kim Jong Il highly praised for his devoted efforts for the wellbeing of his local people. 
					
					 Appointed as the chief secretary of the county party committee some 20 years ago, he began his work with discovery of the revolutionary sites and slogan-bearing trees throughout the county, by dint of workers concerned.
					
					 The county succeeded in discovering revolutionary sites in Paksokgol, Yonbong and Ryonggye areas, as well as some 400 slogan-bearing trees and 200 pieces of relics.
					
					 Meanwhile, he is also a frontrunner in carrying into practice the party's agricultural policy.
					
					 He assigned his only daughter, a secondary school graduate, to a rural community for doing farming. His deed inspired the local people to follow the suit, leading to settlement of the shortage of farms' labor forces in the county.
					
					 He actively helped acclimatize 10 kinds of high-yield strains of seeds to sharply boost the grain output. 
					
					 The county built a tree nursery covering tens of hectares, which cultivates more than 200 000 saplings a year. It also built more than 7 000 housing units, two power stations, a 20-hectare fish farm and a goat farm. 
					
					 All the achievements are believed to be attributable to the devoted efforts the chief secretary made for the improvement of the livelihood of the county dwellers. 
					
					 The series helps the people harden their determination to highly display Kim Jong Il style patriotism.

articles.title: Haegum, Korea's Traditional Instrument
articles.content:
Haegum, Korea's Traditional Instrument
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Haegum, a traditional instrument of Korea, enjoys popularity at home and abroad.
					 Among the numbers of the Unhasu Orchestra performance given in Paris in March this year was a traditional instrumental duet of haegum (Korean four-string fiddle) and kayagum, which won high acclamation.
					
					 Haegum, simple in structure yet unique in timbre, became popular among the Koreans in the latter half of Ri Dynasty (1392-1910).
					
					 It was improved between the late 1960s and the early 1970s.
					
					 Its compass became wide with high, middle, low and lowest pitched sounds.
					
					 Developed haegum, clear, soft and gentle in timbre, is capable of giving any rendition.

articles.title: Song Indicative of Koreans' Reverence for Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Song Indicative of Koreans' Reverence for Kim Jong Un
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The song "We Will Follow You Only ", sung at the May Day Unhasu Concert, has since become popular among the Korean people.
					 The song eulogizes the Korean people's profound reverence for the dear respected Kim Jong Un, who is pursuing politics based on love for the people. 
					
					 It says Kim Jong Un, identical to President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, serves as a symbol of faith for the Korean people.
					
					 "We will hold the dear respected Kim Jong Un in high esteem", the tag of the song, mirrors the people's deep trust in him.
					
					 Pak Un Bok (60), a Pyongyang citizen, told KCNA:
					
					 "The song reflects our minds to follow Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Whenever I see him on TV among soldiers and civilians, I feel his affection. The Korean people are blessed with great leaders."
					
					 Han Jong Son, a worker at the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex, said:
					
					 "As the song says, the Korean people are the happiest in the world.
					
					 Some days ago, when Kim Jong Un inspected the Mangyongdae Funfair, he stressed officials who are inconsiderate of people's interests are useless, however many they may be. The remarks touch my heart.
					
					 I resolved myself to discharge my duty as his soldier."

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Life of Kim Jong Il as Great Patriot
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Life of Kim Jong Il as Great Patriot
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was a peerless patriot who had all his life glorified with patriotic devotion on the basis of his noblest outlook on the country, people and nation, says Rodong Sinmun on Monday in a bylined article.
					 It is hard to find such life as the nearly 70-year-long revolutionary life of Kim Jong Il crowded with manifold trials, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The motherland was the uppermost of all his thoughts and activities and his love for the nation was the source of strength that made him courageously weather all difficulties and trials.
					
					 Patriotic devotion was unconditional and consistent throughout his whole life and most ardent as it was displayed with superhuman energy.
					
					 His revolutionary life was the one of a peerlessly great man who firmly maintained his stand of valuing people. It was also the life of a true patriot who firmly preserved the advantages of the nation and gave full play to them and the life characterized by his patriotic devotion as he dedicated everything to the future of the country.
					
					 Socialist Korea remaining strong thanks to Songun is precious crystal of Kim Jong Il's noble patriotism based on his idea of valuing the people.
					
					 This noble patriotism is now being faithfully carried forward by the dear respected Kim Jong Un, of which the country and nation feel proud.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will steadfastly advance along the road of independence, Songun and socialism, firmly taking the immortal feats Kim Jong Il performed for the prosperity of the country and nation as a precious legacy, concludes the article.

articles.title: Military and Technical Superiority Is Not Exclusive Property of Imperialists: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Military, Technical Superiority Is Not Exclusive Property of Imperialists: Rodong Sinmu
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- As was proved by the military parade held for celebrating the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung, Korea today is no longer what it used to be more than a hundred years ago and gone are the days never to return when aggressors could fire bullets and shells at Koreans as they pleased, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined article.
					  As the Korean people held the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il in high esteem, they could put an end to the era of military and technical superiority of hostile forces and ensure the sovereignty and peace of the country and the nation, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The imperialists have gone to an extreme phase in their moves to obstruct and block the development of military science and technology by the anti-imperialist independent countries. 
					
					 The imperialists are becoming evermore undisguised in their moves to slap harsher sanctions and military blockade against the anti-imperialist independent countries including the DPRK in a bid to deter them from having access to cutting-edge military technology and means. 
					
					 The situation calls upon the said countries to intensify to the maximum the struggle for developing military science and technology by their own efforts in order to boost their military power. 
					
					 It is an important requirement for bolstering military power and an essential condition for foiling the military blockade of the imperialists and having access to means for self-defence to develop military science and technology with indigenous technology and their own efforts. 
					
					 No country is neither ready to help others develop military science and technology nor in a position to do so. One's driving force is the only force to count on. 
					
					 Cutting-edge military science and technology are neither a fortress unconquerable nor something mysterious.
					
					 Moreover, it is not something that allows the imperialists to monopolize. Science has no state boundary and allows no monopoly.
					
					 As a matter of fact, the DPRK's military power has made a positive contribution to smashing the imperialists' moves for a war of aggression and ensuring peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Bellicose Forces' Moves for Another Korean War
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Bellicose Forces' Moves for Another Korean War
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The U.S. war-thirsty forces are busy floating the story about "the north's invasion of the U.S. and south Korea" and crying out for "careful examination" of a war strategy to cope with it.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This indicates that those who steeped in hostility toward the DPRK to the marrow of their bones are running the whole gamut of plots to ignite another Korean war at any cost.
					
					 The U.S. is getting evermore keen these days to launch a new Korean war, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 Strategists of the U.S. Department of Defense have worked out a plan to hurl its air force and navy on a priority basis and let the south Korean puppet army conduct a ground warfare as its main duty in case of "invasion" by the DPRK. They are busy working out a war scenario which calls for the involvement of U.S. forces in the event of a large conflict, the reduction of the U.S. ground force taking part in battles and the filling of the gap with troops of its allies.
					
					 The U.S. has rounded off its scenario for a war against the DPRK while staging Key Resolve and Foal Eagle and other joint military exercises together with south Korean puppet forces under the pretext of coping with "invasion of south Korea" by the DPRK.
					
					 It is massively concentrating its aggression forces in south Korea and in its vicinity.
					
					 It is the U.S. aim to invade the DPRK by force of arms and establish military domination over the Eurasian Continent with the Korean Peninsula as a springboard.
					
					 The U.S. brass hats' projected reexamination of their war strategy is harmful in every sense as it will prove to be a serious military strategic mistake.
					
					 If the U.S. imperialists and their followers dare ignite a war against the DPRK, they will face unimaginably deadly retaliatory strikes of the DPRK, warns the commentary.

articles.title: DPRK Will Not Give up Sovereignty: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK Will Not Give Up Sovereignty: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea has craftily linked the DPRK's exercise of its sovereignty with financial issue in recent days.
					 The Unites States is also building up public opinion, saying "the north had better give up nuclear development and missile launch and take care of its people" to incite the puppet forces of south Korea to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined commentary says in this regard:
					
					 They do not worry or care about the life of people in the DPRK. What they said was just the scream of the hostile forces to the DPRK in fear of the matchless military capacities of the DPRK.
					
					 The Lee group has escalated confrontation with the DPRK while citing something like the cost to pull up the sovereign right of the DPRK. This is a last ditch effort to get rid of dilemma caused by its failed "policy towards the north".
					
					 The group craftily invented "a new method of approaching" the north in order to retrieve their repeated failures in their plan to hurt the DPRK through nuclear racket and missile racket against it in collusion with foreign forces.
					
					 By slandering the DPRK's exercise of its sovereignty by directly connecting the cost issue with the "economy and people's livelihood" and creating an international opinion critical of the DPRK, they sought to undermine the people's trust in socialism.
					
					 This is a ridiculous mischief of the sharks to break the single-minded unity in the DPRK.
					
					 The single-minded unity, a valuable heritage provided by the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu, has been cemented and consolidated generation after generation.
					
					 The DPRK will never give up its sovereignty no matter how desperately the hostile forces run amuck and will resolutely counter their vicious acts of hurting it without any compromise.

articles.title: S. Korea Plans to Stage Field Tactical Exercise
articles.content:
S. Korea Plans to Stage Field Tactical Exercise
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The 25th division of the south Korean puppet army announced that it would stage a field tactical exercise from May 15 to 25 in the area of Kyonggi Province, according to Yonhap News.
					 The warmongers scheme to involve huge war means and troops in the field exercise, citing "infiltration" of someone.
					
					 The rat-like Lee Myung Bak group is forsaken by the nation for its thrice-cursed provocations against the DPRK. But it plans to stage war exercise against the DPRK, escalating confrontation with it to prolong its remaining days.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Slam Authorities' Deceptive Moves
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Slam "Government" Authorities' Deceptive Moves
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The Measure Council for Checking the Construction of the Jeju Naval Base of south Korea, the All Islanders Measure Committee for Checking the Jeju Military Base and Kangjong Village Association on May 8 issued a joint statement condemning the "government" authorities for their deceptive moves as regards the Jeju naval base construction.
					 The present authorities claim that the naval base can be put into civilian use also, a trick to deceive the people, the statement said, adding:
					
					 The south Korean defense ministry on May 4 announced the Jeju port would be a military facility reserve area even after it was chosen as a trade port. On April 26 it clarified in a revised version of the enforcement ordinance "law on protection of military bases and facilities" that "it shall provide the entry and departure of ships specified by the commanding officer with jurisdiction power."
					
					 This means the Jeju naval base will remain the military facility reserve area irrespective of its selection as a trade port and the civilian ship will have to get permission of the competent commanding officer for entry or departure. This indicates the defense ministry's clear intention not to hand over the right to control the port to the Jeju Island side.
					
					 The statement called for halting the Jeju naval base construction which threatens the people's life, pollutes natural environment and destroys peace.
					
					 The Jeju Island side should stand firm against the "government", not reading its face any more, it stressed.

articles.title: Memorial for Workers Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
Memorial for Workers Held in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- A memorial took place in Seoul on May 11 for workers of Ssangryong Motors who met death after being laid off by the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors.
					 At the memorial speakers said that dozens of workers and their families lost their lives due to pressure and exploitation by the company and "government."
					
					 However, no measures have been taken to ensure workers' vital rights, they said, venting their anger over the abyss of death more people are falling into.
					
					 All people can live with their families only when they are freed from unreasonable lay-off, they noted, underscoring the necessity of the struggle against lay-off.
					
					 They called on the people from all walks of life to stand firm against the "government" authorities' unpopular rule in a bid to help the workers of Ssangryong Motors wreak their grudge.
					
					 They will fight it out till the day when the workers go back to the factory, they declared.

articles.title: Stop to Conclusion of Military Agreements with Japan Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Stop to Conclusion of Military Agreements with Japan Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The Confederation of Organizations for Anti-Japanese Independent Movement of south Korea and the People's Action for Renegotiations on Agreements between South Korea and Japan issued a joint statement on Friday in denunciation of the warlike forces' moves for concluding military agreements with Japan that is aimed to bring the danger of war to the Korean Peninsula.
					 Their attempt to conclude military agreements with Japan despite unanimous opposition of the people not only runs counter to the desire and wish of the nation for peace and reunification but invites the danger of war to the Korean Peninsula, the statement said.
					
					 Lee Myung Bak plans to tighten military alliance with the U.S. and Japan and actively back his group's return to power through the conclusion of military agreements with Japan, it noted.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak bellicose forces would be well advised to know that they would never escape the severe punishment by history for their reckless acts of trying to plunge the Korean Peninsula into the crucible of a war, it warned.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Speech Carried by Nepalese Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Speech Carried by Nepalese Paper
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The Nepalese paper Nepal Today on May 8 carried the gist of a speech made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un on April 15, 2012 at a military parade celebrating the 100th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's birth. It was illustrated with his photo.
					 Kim Jong Un said in his speech that the 100-year history of Kim Il Sung's nation clearly proves the iron truth that outstanding leaders assure the dignity and prosperity of a country and nation.
					
					 Clarified in the speech is an idea that the Korean People's Army which recorded only victories has assured the glorious 100-year history of Juche Korea and this constitutes a sure guarantee for the ever-lasting history of Kim Il Sung's nation, Kim Jong Il's Korea.
					
					 In his speech he referred to the tasks for exalting the dignity of Songun Korea for all ages and successfully accomplishing the cause of building a thriving socialist nation, etc.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Posted on Website of British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Posted on Website of British Organization 
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted on its internet website on May 6 the full texts of a speech made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un and a talk he had with leading officials of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The speech made at a military parade held on Apr. 15 in celebration of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung clarified that the 100-year history of Kim Il Sung's nation clearly proves the iron truth that outstanding leaders assure the dignity and prosperity of a country and nation.
					
					 The speech indicates tasks for exalting the dignity of Songun Korea for all ages and successfully accomplishing the cause of building a thriving socialist nation, etc.
					
					 The talk "Let Us Hold Great Comrade Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as General Secretary of Our Party Forever and Successfully Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche" made public on Apr. 6, 2012 clarifies that it is a principled requirement for victoriously advancing the revolutionary cause of Korea to hold General Secretary Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the WPK. 
					
					 It also lays down tasks to be fulfilled to steadily develop the WPK into a glorious party of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A photo of Kim Jong Un was also posted on the website.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Praised by Peruvian Political Party
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Praised by Peruvian Political Party
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The Socialist Party of Peru issued a statement on May 7 as regards a talk the dear respected Kim Jong Un had with leading officials of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and a speech he made at a military parade.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Kim Jong Un, a great successor to the revolutionary cause of Juche, indicated an orientation and ways for developing the WPK in his work on April 6 "Let Us Hold Great Comrade Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as General Secretary of Our Party Forever and Successfully Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche".
					
					 The WPK is a glorious party that holds President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il as its eternal leaders and takes Kimilsungism and Kimjongilism as its immutable guiding idea.
					
					 Under the outstanding leadership of Kim Jong Un, the WPK will protect the people's interests and meet them as a guide of socialism and victoriously advance the drive for building a thriving nation by dint of single-minded unity.
					
					 The speech made by First Secretary of the WPK Kim Jong Un at a military parade held in celebration of the centenary of Kim Il Sung's birth serves as a programme that should be taken as guidelines for more firmly defending and glorifying socialism of Juche and accomplishing national reunification.
					
					 Kim Jong Un in his speech set forth important tasks to be fulfilled by socialist Korea to augment its national power and military capacity in every way. 
					
					 The Korean People's Army under the great Supreme Commander is invincible revolutionary armed forces that plays a leading role in the revolutionary cause of Songun and building a thriving nation, decisively foils the imperialists' moves for aggression and defends the Korean revolution and socialist gains. 
					
					 The Socialist Party of Peru extends support and solidarity to the WPK and the Korean people in their struggle for socialism and national reunification.

articles.title: DPRK's Rejection of UNSC's "Joint Statement" Supported in Britain
articles.content:
DPRK's Rejection of UNSC's "Joint Statement" Supported in Britain
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- British organizations issued a joint statement on May 7 in support of an answer given by the DPRK Foreign Ministry that rejected a "joint statement" of permanent members of the UN Security Council.
					 They were the Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association.
					
					 The statement dismissed the UNSC's interference in and demeanor over the internal affairs of the DPRK as inadmissible and unfair.
					
					 We fully support the stand of the DPRK, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The permanent members of the UNSC went too far in their acts as they were double-faced.
					
					 The permanent members top the world list of countries that conducted nuclear tests. 
					
					  Moreover, the United States is the only country that used nuclear weapons.
					
					 Nevertheless, the UNSC proposed an unacceptable demand at the instigation of the U.S.
					
					 The UNSC is increasingly losing international trust and is being reduced to a troublesome body. 
					
					 It is a legitimate right of the DPRK to develop outer space and the nuclear power industry for peaceful purposes.
					
					 It is another legitimate right of the DPRK to access nuclear deterrent to counter the U.S. imperialists' nuclear threat.
					
					 The criticism of the DPRK's development of space and nuclear power industry is part of sordid and black-hearted attempt to obstruct its independent development and bring down its socialist system centered on popular masses.
					
					 The UNSC was reduced into a tool serving the U.S. imperialists and its followers in their efforts to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 The acts of the UNSC's permanent members run counter to the September 19 statement.
					
					  The UNSC's recent "joint statement" does not give any help to settling the nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula but renders it more complicated, instead.
					
					 We support the DPRK's independent and legitimate right to nuclear use.

articles.title: Iran Will Not Retreat from Its Rights: President
articles.content:
Iran Will Not Retreat from Its Rights: President
 Tehran, May 13 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad said that the Islamic republic will not retreat an iota from its rights under pressure of sanctions over its nuclear programme.
					 Talking in the northeastern city of Torbat-e Jam on Friday, the president said that "they (West) should know that this (Iranian) nation will not retreat even an iota from its inalienable rights."

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recorre varios puntos de Indonesia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recorre varios puntos de Indonesia
Pyongyang, 14 de mayo (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam,  presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, deposito el dia 14 una ofrenda floral ante el Cementerio Nacional de Heroes situado en la Yakarta.
					Kim y su comitiva guardaron un memento de silencio en memoria de los martires quienes sacrificaron sus nobles vidas por la liberacion nacional de Indonesia.
					
					El mismo dia, ellos visitaron el Monumento Nacional.
					
					Los visitantes escucharon explicaciones de que fue establecido el Monumento para transmitir la lucha del pueblo indonesio por conquistar la independencia nacional y infundir a las generaciones venideras el patriotismo.
					
					Oyeron en voz viva el discurso de primer presidente Sukarno declarando la independencia de Indonesia y vieron el documento de Declaracion de la Independencia firmado por el.
					
					Subieron al mirador del Monumento, de donde contemplaron la ciudad de Yakarta.
					
					Kim dejo las letras en el libro de visitas.

articles.title: Inaugurada feria internacional de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Inaugurada feria internacional de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 14 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 14 en la Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones la ceremonia inaugural de la XV Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Primaveral de Pyongyang.
					A la ocasion asistieron el vicepremier Kang Sok Ju, el ministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Ryong Nam y otros, asi como las delegaciones de varios paises y regiones y los representantes diplomaticos y los miembros de las embajadas de varios paises, acreditados en Corea.
					
					El director de la Agencia de Exposicion Internacional de Corea Kim Mun Jong pronuncio el discurso de apertura, seguido de la palabra de felicitacion pronunciada por el viceministro de Comercio Exterior, O Ryong Chol.
					
					Los oradores felicitaron a las delegaciones de varios paises y regiones participantes en la feria.
					
					Ellos dijeron que la presente feria es una prestigiosa cita economica internacional que obedece a la aspiracion y deseo de la humanidad de establecer un nuevo orden economico mundial en base a la independencia y lograr la prosperidad y desarrollo comunes.
					
					Desearon a los participantes que logren durante la feria magnificos exitos a traves de un amplio contacto y activas transacciones comerciales.
					
					Subrayaron que tambien en el futuro, Corea desarrollara y fortalecera la cooperacion bilateral y multilateral con varios paises y regiones del mundo en el dominio de economia y comercio respetando el principio de igualdad y beneficio mutuo.
					
					Terminada la ceremonia, los participantes pasaron revista a los articulos exhibidos por las companias de Corea, Holanda, Alemania, Bulgaria, Suiza, Gran Bretana, Austria, Italia, Finlandia, Polonia, Australia, Malasia, Mongolia, China y Taipei China.
					
					La feria continuara hasta el 17.
